Description: Mould-made oil-lamp in the form of Harpocrates wearing a festival wreth and side lock. Black ware, with black slip, possibly over-fired. Grey-brown Nile silt with abundant mica and sand inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Egyptian Museum, Cairo. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Similar handle to lamps Q571 and Q576 and similar style to lamp Q578 (Bailey 1975: 268). All three parallels are of 1st century BC Egyptian production and acquired in Egypt, presently in the British Museum (BM GR 1925,1120.60, 1966,1213.15, 1966,0216.76), particulaly from Naukratis (GR1886,0401.1434 ). Fabric is identical to figures made in Naukratis suggesting local production, if not from Naukratis then this is from somewhere in the Nile Delta region.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (KD.067) (Phase 3)
